channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tito Jackson, Singer and Guitarist for the Jackson 5, Dies at 70
item.description: Mr. Jackson, alongside Michael and his other brothers, provided a soundtrack for a generation of young listeners in the 1970s.

item.title: How Rituals of Faith Became Another Casualty of War
Malaysia’s only casino is in the political crosshairs as an Islamic party calls for its closure
item.description: The casino, operating since 1969, is in a state the Parti Islam SeMalaysia, an Islamic political party, wants to win.

item.title: As Federal Reserve Readies Interest Rate Cut, Risks to Job Market Still Loom
item.description: The Federal Reserve is poised to lower interest rates this week. Recent jobs data have been a reminder that a soft landing is not yet assured.

item.title: Top Biden Aide to Visit Israel Amid Fears of Escalation With Hezbollah
item.description: The visit by the adviser, Amos Hochstein, comes as cross-border clashes between Israel’s military and the powerful Lebanese militia have intensified.

item.title: Michael O’Leary says Ryanair’s value is depressed because he keeps calling people idiots
item.description: "We’re fighting some union or some minister or I’m calling some minister an idiot or they’re calling me an idiot,” O'Leary said.

item.title: How Rituals of Faith Became Another Casualty of War
China Pushes to Dominate the South China Sea and Force the Philippines Out
item.description: As China pushes to dominate the South China Sea, it is increasingly willing to use force to drive out the Philippines. In recent months, China’s tacti...

item.title: The ‘flagship office’ is on the rise—and it uses the principles of the experience economy to coax employees back to their desks
item.description: These carefully redesigned built environments, compelling stories, and authentic experiences would in fact be well worth an admission fee.

item.title: Trump Safe After ‘Attempted Assassination,’ and TikTok Heads to Court
item.description: Plus, a record-setting Emmy haul for “Shogun.”

item.title: Shanghai is Hit By Typhoon Bebinca, Strongest Storm in 70 Years
item.description: The city canceled all flights at its two airports and closed major attractions, amid a three-day national holiday.

item.title: Shanghai battered by Typhoon Bebinca, the strongest storm since 1949: ‘If I step out…I can barely speak’
item.description: The municipal news service said the typhoon had caused "significant damage across the city", felling over 1,800 trees and leaving 30,000 households wi...

item.title: Top Biden Aide to Visit Israel Amid Fears of Escalation With Hezbollah
item.description: The visit by the adviser, Amos Hochstein, comes as cross-border clashes between Israel’s military and the powerful Lebanese militia have intensified.

item.title: In Linda Sun’s Case, Signs of a Familiar China Playbook
item.description: Linda Sun is just the latest member of the Chinese diaspora whom Beijing is accused of recruiting to influence Western democracies.

item.title: A.I. might actually help us find a greater sense of purpose at work
item.description: If A.I. replaces mundane tasks, that frees us up to build human connections and invest in personal growth. There’s still a risk, though.
